definitions.definition: On board; into or within a ship or boat; hence, into or within a railway car.
On or onto a horse, a camel, etc.

definitions.example: He doubled with two men aboard, scoring them both.

definitions.definition: Into a team, group, or company.
definitions.example: The office manager welcomed him aboard.
The captain laid his ship aboard the enemy's ship.

definitions.definition: On board of; onto or into a ship, boat, train, plane.
definitions.example: We all went aboard the ship.
